meanings.definition: To offer or present something for acceptance or rejection.
meanings.sent1: She decided to porge her homemade cookies to her friends.
meanings.sent2: He will porge his business proposal to the investors tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to porge a dead mouse as a gift to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The teacher porge knowledge to the eager students like a fountain of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The magician porge a bouquet of flowers from his hat, surprising the audience.

meanings.definition: To put forward or propose an idea or argument.
meanings.sent1: He likes to porge new theories during class discussions.
meanings.sent2: She will porge her suggestion at the next team meeting.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to porge a joke that fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The activist porge a compelling case for environmental conservation.
meanings.sent5: The student porge a creative project idea to the teacher for approval.

meanings.definition: To serve or provide food or drink to someone.
meanings.sent1: The waiter will porge the customers their meals shortly.
meanings.sent2: She loves to porge her guests with delicious homemade treats.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to porge drinks at the party.
meanings.sent4: The cafeteria staff porge nutritious meals to the students every day.
meanings.sent5: The kind neighbor porge freshly baked bread to the new family in the neighborhood.
